summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It submits a joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire for the trial, notes areas of disagreement between the prosecution and defense, and requests the documents be filed under seal to avoid prejudicial media coverage.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; the letter is addressed to her.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who respectfully submits the letter.

connections.description: Williams, as U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor for the government in the criminal case against Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over Maxwell's criminal trial.

events.title: Court Order on Jury Selection
events.description: The Court issued an order (Dkt. No. 330) regarding procedures for the upcoming trial, leading to the submission of the joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire.

events.title: Submission of Jury Selection Materials
events.description: The Government, with defense counsel, submits joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire documents to the court, noting areas of disagreement.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a procedural filing in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The prosecution and defense collaborated on proposed jury selection materials but had specific disagreements, which are annotated in the submission.
The defense requested, and the prosecution consented to, filing the juror questionnaire and voir dire under seal to prevent prejudicial media influence on jury selection.
The filing indicates the trial preparation phase was active in October 2021, focusing on jury selection procedures.
